node.title: Aishwarya Aswath's parents disappointed at findings of new report into daughter's hospital death
node.alt: A head and shoulders of a young girl smiling, wearing sunglasses and holding two thumbs up
node.description: An independent inquiry into the death of a seven-year-old girl at Perth Children's Hospital makes several recommendations for change, but leaves her parents without closure.
node.content:
["An independent inquiry into the death of a seven-year-old girl at Perth Children's Hospital has made several recommendations for change, but has left her parents without closure.", "Aishwarya Aswath died from organ failure due to sepsis at the emergency department of Perth's flagship children's hospital just after 9:00pm on April 3.", "The independent inquiry, undertaken by the Australian Commission on Safety and Quality in Health Care, made 30 recommendations for change.", "They include recognising parental input, improving the nurse and medical workforce, improving the layout of the hospital's emergency department, and improving the understanding of CALD patients and their families.", "", "
Nurses at Perth Children's Hospital held a rally after the death of Aishwarya.(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "A spokesman for the family, Suresh Rajan, said Aishwarya's parents were disappointed with the external review because it did not provide them with specific answers about what led to her death.", "He said her parents would like the coronial inquiry into her death to be expedited, and for CCTV from the night she died at Perth Children's Hospital (PCH)\u00a0to be released.", "
Cook hoping report\u00a0'honours legacy' of Aishwarya
", "Health Minister Roger Cook said all 30 recommendations from the latest report would be accepted and acted upon immediately.", "\"What I hope most of all is that the actions taken from this report honour the legacy of Aishwarya, and the commitment of her parents Aswath and Prasitha,\" Mr Cook said.", "", "
Health Minister Roger Cook says all 30 recommendations in the report will be followed.(ABC News: Keane Bourke)
", "An initial \"root cause analysis\" internal investigation found there was\u00a0a cascade of missed opportunities to address her parents' concerns while waiting in the emergency department.", "It revealed a nurse noted the parents were \"anxious and concerned about their daughter\", but nonetheless the \"parental concern\" was considered \"absent\" by staff, resulting in a score of zero for this criteria.", "Eleven recommendations were made, including improvement to the triage process, a clear pathway for parents to escalate concerns to staff, a review of cultural awareness and the development of an established sepsis recognition diagnostic tool in the PCH emergency department.", "Two nurses and a doctor were referred to the federal health regulator, the\u00a0Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Agency (AHPRA), after the root cause analysis was released.", "
Report criticises referrals
", "WA Health director-general David Russell-Weisz acknowledged the latest report criticised those AHPRA referrals.", "\"The AHPRA referrals rekindled some historical tensions between the clinical workforce and the executive management team,\" he said.", "Aishwarya's parents Aswath Chavittupara and Prasitha Sasidharan were unsatisfied with the internal review and began a hunger strike in early May\u00a0to call for the independent inquiry, in a bid to ensure no other parents suffered the same ordeal they went through.", "", "
Parents Aswath Chavittupara and Prasitha Sasidharan campaigned for an external review.(ABC News: West\u00a0Matteeussen)
", "On May 25, WA Health Minister Roger Cook announced an independent investigation, saying it\u00a0would take about 10 weeks to complete.", "The Aswath family finally received a copy of the report on Monday,\u00a025 weeks after Mr Cook's announcement."]
